Class MachineOpponent

java.lang.Object
com.battleship.models.MachineOpponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class MachineOpponent extends Object implements Runnable
Simple AI opponent that fires shots at a target Board.

This class belongs to the Model layer (game logic) and runs on its own thread. It implements Runnable so it can be executed by a Thread from the controller.

Behavior:

  • Selects random coordinates that have not been fired upon yet.
  • Calls Board.receiveShot(Coordinate) to apply the shot to the model.
  • Notifies a GameEventListener (typically the controller) with the shot result.
  • Continues shooting if it hits or sinks a ship; stops when it misses (water).

Thread control:

  • The running flag is volatile to allow safe stop requests from other threads.
  • The loop simulates "thinking time" using Thread.sleep(long).

  • Constructor Details

    • MachineOpponent

      public MachineOpponent(Board targetBoard, GameEventListener listener)
      Creates a new AI opponent.
      Parameters:
      targetBoard - board that the AI will attack
      listener - listener that will be notified after each shot (may be null)

  • Method Details

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Requests the AI loop to stop.

      The AI will stop after the current iteration finishes.

    • run

      public void run()
      AI main loop.

      The AI continues shooting while:

      • running is true, and
      • the last shot was not a miss (result != 0).

      Shot result codes come from Board.receiveShot(Coordinate):

      • 0 = miss (water)
      • 1 = hit
      • 2 = sunk
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
